summary: The Kay Hagan Tick Reauthorization Act, introduced in the Senate, aims to reauthorize programs related to vector-borne diseases, specifically focusing on tick-borne illnesses. The bill amends the Public Health Service Act, modifying the composition of the Tick-Borne Disease Working Group and adjusting funding levels for national strategy, regional centers of excellence, and support for health departments. Funding is reauthorized for fiscal years 2026-2030.
